name: Tomatoes
lifeCycle: 90-150 days from seed to harvest, depending on variety
growthPattern: Indeterminate varieties continue producing throughout the season; determinate varieties produce a single harvest
keyRequirements: Full sun (6+ hours daily), consistent moisture, temperatures between 18-29°C (65-85°F)
beginnerTips: Choose determinate/bush varieties for easier management. Use cages for support and mulch to conserve moisture.
advancedTips: Try grafting tomatoes onto disease-resistant rootstocks and implement succession planting for continuous harvest.

risks.description: Temperatures below 10°C (50°F) or above 35°C (95°F) can cause blossom drop and reduce fruit set.
risks.mitigation: Use row covers or shade cloth depending on the temperature extreme. Consider heat-tolerant varieties in hot regions.

risks.description: High humidity increases risk of fungal diseases like early blight and late blight.
risks.mitigation: Maintain good air circulation, use drip irrigation, and apply organic fungicides preventatively in humid conditions.

risks.description: Tomato hornworm, aphids, and whiteflies can reduce yields if not managed.
risks.mitigation: Regularly inspect plants, use companion planting with basil or marigolds, and introduce beneficial insects.

name: Cucumbers
growthPattern: Vining or bush varieties available; vining types can be trellised for space efficiency
keyRequirements: Full sun, warm soil (above 16°C/60°F), consistent moisture
beginnerTips: Choose bush varieties for containers and small spaces. Harvest frequently for continued production.
advancedTips: Implement vertical growing techniques and alternate-day harvesting schedule for maximum yields.

risks.description: Growth stops below 15°C (59°F); bitter fruits may develop above 32°C (90°F).
risks.mitigation: Use plastic mulch to warm soil early in the season and provide afternoon shade in peak summer heat.

risks.description: Powdery mildew and downy mildew are common in humid conditions.
risks.mitigation: Choose resistant varieties, maintain good airflow, and use preventative organic fungicides.

risks.description: Poor pollination can result in misshapen fruits.
risks.mitigation: Plant pollinator-attracting flowers nearby or hand-pollinate flowers in enclosed environments.

name: Bell Peppers
lifeCycle: 60-90 days from transplant to first harvest
growthPattern: Compact bushy plants that may require staking when heavy with fruit
keyRequirements: Full sun, warm temperatures (21-29°C/70-85°F), moderate but consistent moisture
beginnerTips: Start with compact varieties that don't require staking. Harvest at desired color stage – green is earliest.
advancedTips: Prune to maintain 2-3 main stems for larger fruits and implement calcium supplementation for stronger cell walls.

risks.description: Flower drop occurs below 15°C (59°F) or above 32°C (90°F).
risks.mitigation: Use row covers for cold protection and shade cloth during heat waves. Avoid planting during extreme temperature periods.

risks.description: Direct intense sunlight can cause sunscald on fruits in very hot regions.
risks.mitigation: Maintain healthy foliage coverage and consider partial shade in hottest regions during peak summer.

risks.description: Aphids and spider mites are common in hot, dry conditions.
risks.mitigation: Regular monitoring and occasional spraying with insecticidal soap. Maintain adequate humidity for mite prevention.

name: Eggplant
growthPattern: Bushy plants with woody stems that require support when fruiting heavily
keyRequirements: High heat (21-32°C/70-90°F), full sun, consistent moisture
beginnerTips: Choose smaller-fruited varieties for faster production. Harvest when skin is glossy for best flavor.
advancedTips: Implement pruning to limit plants to 5-6 fruits at once for larger size. Use foil mulch to increase heat reflection.

risks.description: Plants may stop growing below 15°C (59°F) and suffer damage below 10°C (50°F).
risks.mitigation: Wait until soil and air temperatures are consistently warm before planting. Use black plastic mulch to warm soil.

risks.description: Highly attractive to flea beetles, spider mites, and aphids.
risks.mitigation: Use floating row covers until plants are established. Regular spraying with neem oil can deter multiple pests.

risks.description: Susceptible to verticillium wilt, especially in soil where related crops have grown.
risks.mitigation: Implement crop rotation of at least 3 years. Choose resistant varieties when available.

name: Hot Peppers
lifeCycle: 80-120 days from transplant to harvest, depending on variety
keyRequirements: Heat-loving (21-32°C/70-90°F), full sun, moderate water (less than bell peppers)
beginnerTips: Start with milder varieties like jalapeño or poblano. Wear gloves when handling hot peppers.
advancedTips: Try pruning flowers during early growth stage to encourage stronger plants and higher yields later.

risks.description: Slow growth below 18°C (65°F); may drop flowers in extreme heat >35°C (95°F).
risks.mitigation: Wait until temperatures are consistently warm before planting. Provide afternoon shade in hottest regions.

risks.description: Different hot pepper varieties can cross-pollinate, affecting next generation's heat level.
risks.mitigation: Separate different pepper varieties by at least 50 feet or use barriers if saving seeds.

risks.description: Overwatering can lead to root diseases; underwatering may cause blossom end rot.
risks.mitigation: Allow soil to dry slightly between waterings. Use consistent watering schedule and mulch to maintain even moisture.
